item.title: 迪拜港务集团暂停杰贝阿里港运营
item.description: 据彭博社获得的一份发给客户的通知显示，迪拜环球港务集团已作为预防措施暂时暂停了杰贝阿里港的运营。【原文：DP World suspended operations at the Jebel Ali port in Dubai temporarily as a precautionary measure, according to a notice sent to customers and seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 苹果触控款MacBook将远未达到Mac与iPad混合体的程度
item.description: 苹果即将推出的触屏版MacBook Pro将表明，该公司距离整合Mac和iPad仍相去甚远。此外：苹果正为零售店做准备，以应对本周新产品引发的巨大关注，同时正为开发者推出全新的人工智能框架。【原文：Apple’s upcoming touch-screen MacBook Pro will show the company is still far from combining the Mac and iPad. Also: Apple is preparing its retail stores for significant interest in this coming week’s new products, and it’s readying a new artificial intelligence framework for developers.】

item.title: 前高盛CEO担忧"清算时刻"来临，私人信贷正涌向普通民众
item.description: 曾带领高盛集团度过2008年金融危机的劳埃德·布兰克费恩，如今正敲响警钟——华尔街正将美国储户的资金导入其最新的信贷狂潮：私募信贷。【原文：Lloyd Blankfein, who led Goldman Sachs Group Inc. through the 2008 financial crisis, is now ringing alarm bells as Wall Street steers cash from US savers into its latest lending binge: private credit.】

item.title: 中国荣耀展示人形机器人与手机演示，开启人工智能转型
item.description: 荣耀设备公司周日在巴塞罗那世界移动通信大会2026上展示了人形机器人及其所谓的机器人手机，这家中国设备制造商正致力于转型为人工智能驱动的硬件公司。【原文：Honor Device Co. demonstrated a humanoid robot and its so-called robot phone at MWC Barcelona 2026 on Sunday, as the Chinese device maker seeks to reinvent itself as an artificial intelligence-driven hardware company.】

item.title: 沙特、埃及股市暴跌，美伊冲突搅动中东局势
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯和埃及股市周日下跌，这是美伊战争冲击该地区金融市场的首个迹象之一。【原文：Saudi Arabian and Egyptian stocks fell on Sunday, in one of the first signs of the US-Iran war hitting the region’s financial markets.】

item.title: 比亚迪2月汽车销量暴跌41%，国内需求持续萎缩
item.description: 比亚迪公司2月份汽车销量同比下滑41%，此前创纪录的春节假期导致中国大部分时间内生产和零售活动几乎陷入停滞。【原文：BYD Co. reported a 41% drop in vehicle sales for February from a year earlier, after a record-long Lunar New Year holiday brought production and retail activity in China to a near standstill for much of the month.】

item.title: 欧佩克+代表团原则上同意4月增产20.6万桶/日
item.description: 代表们表示，欧佩克+原则上同意下月增产原油，而美国和以色列对伊朗的袭击引发的冲突则可能推高原油价格的涨势。【原文：OPEC+ agreed in principle to increase oil production next month, delegates said, as a conflict sparked by US-Israeli strikes on Iran threatened to bolster a rally in crude prices.】

item.title: 全球盈利凸显美国地位动摇，标普500指数重挫
item.description: 随着最新财报季落幕，投资者错过部分精彩表现实属情有可原——人工智能对市场叙事的垄断、地缘政治焦虑以及贸易不确定性的再度升温，都让市场难有余力关注其他动态。【原文：As the latest earnings season wraps, investors could be forgiven for missing some of the fireworks, what with AI’s stranglehold on the market narrative, geopolitical angst and renewed trade uncertainty.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击事件中，华尔街转向"避风港优先"策略
item.description: 中东地区迅速蔓延的冲突正加剧投资者焦虑，并强化了对美国国债、黄金和瑞士法郎等避险资产的需求。【原文：The fast‑moving conflict across the Middle East is heightening investor anxiety and strengthening the case for safe‑haven trades such as Treasuries, gold and the Swiss franc.】

item.title: 英伟达组建联盟，确保6G网络拥抱人工智能
item.description: 全球市值最高的企业英伟达公司正全力支持一项计划，旨在确保即将推出的6G手机网络为人工智能相关服务和设备提供强大的平台支撑。【原文：Nvidia Corp., the world’s most valuable company, is throwing its weight behind an effort to make sure the forthcoming 6G phone networks provide a strong platform for services and devices that take advantage of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 斯塔默如何意外找到解决英国困境的法式方案
item.description: 英国的增长计划很简单：它希望通过增加投资来提高生产力，从而提升工资水平并改善民生。然而，这会带来一个不幸的后果：失业。【原文：The UK’s growth plan is simple. It wants more investment to deliver higher productivity that lifts wages and boosts living standards. There is an unfortunate consequence, however: unemployment.】

item.title: 东京电力公司暂时削减可再生能源
item.description: 东京电力公司旗下子公司周日要求可再生能源生产商削减五小时发电量，因预计电力供应将超过需求。【原文：A Tokyo Electric Power Co. unit told renewable-energy producers to curtail output for five hours on Sunday, with electricity supply projected to surpass demand.】

item.title: 法国达飞海运暂停船舶通过苏伊士运河
item.description: 全球第三大集装箱航运公司法国达飞海运集团（CMA CGM SA）已要求波斯湾海域的船舶立即避风，并暂停通过苏伊士运河的航行。【原文：France’s CMA CGM SA, the world’s third-largest container line, told vessels in the Persian Gulf to take shelter immediately and suspended passage through the Suez Canal.】

item.title: 澳门博彩收入因农历新年热潮超预期
item.description: 澳门二月份博彩收入增长4.5%，增幅超出预期。作为全球最大的博彩中心，澳门受益于农历新年旅游旺季带来的提振。【原文：Macau’s gaming revenue rose a stronger-than-expected 4.5% in February, as the world’s biggest gambling hub benefited from a Lunar New Year tourism boost.】

item.title: 伊朗危机恐将引发2022年以来天然气市场最严重扰乱
item.description: 中东冲突不断扩大，预计将对天然气市场造成自四年前俄罗斯入侵乌克兰颠覆全球贸易以来最严重的冲击。【原文：A widening Middle East conflict looks set to create the most significant disruption for gas markets since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine upended global trade four years ago.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击导致数千航班中断；迪拜机场遭袭
item.description: 随着中东地区冲突不断升级，数千架次航班受到影响。迪拜主要机场——全球最繁忙的航空枢纽——在疑似遭受空袭后已实质性关闭。【原文：Thousands of flights have been disrupted in the wake of the escalating conflict engulfing the Middle East, with Dubai’s main airport — the world’s busiest aviation hub — effectively shut down after it was hit by a suspected aerial strike.】

item.title: 日本航运公司暂停在波斯湾的运营
item.description: 随着伊朗军事冲突升级，日本航运公司已暂停在波斯湾的运营。【原文：Japanese shipping companies have suspended operations in the Persian Gulf as the military conflict in Iran escalates.】

item.title: 韩国出口势头持续，货币政策压力缓解
item.description: 韩国2月出口增速加快，这强化了该国央行观点：强劲的半导体需求正助力缓冲经济冲击，央行在维持中性政策立场的同时正密切关注金融稳定风险。【原文：South Korea’s exports accelerated in February, reinforcing the central bank’s view that solid semiconductor demand is helping cushion the economy as it maintains a neutral policy stance while monitoring financial stability risks.】

item.title: 中国政策峰会聚焦科技与刺激政策，引发投资者关注
item.description: 中国将于下周启动年度最重要的政治会议，投资者正密切关注北京方面如何在推进科技雄心的同时，重振脆弱的消费经济。【原文：China kicks off its most important annual political meeting next week, with investors seeking clarity on how Beijing intends to press ahead with its tech ambitions while reviving a fragile consumer economy.】

item.title: 泰国黄金交易限制措施生效，当局收紧泰铢汇率管控
item.description: 泰国将于3月1日起实施针对零售黄金交易的严格新规，旨在遏制助推泰铢升值、削弱国家竞争力的投机活动。【原文：Thailand will implement tough new rules governing retail gold-trading from March 1, hoping to curb speculative activity that’s fueled gains in the baht and weakened the nation’s competitiveness.】

item.title: 波利市场伊朗押注额达5.29亿美元，新型钱包引发关注
item.description: 当美以联军本周末对伊朗发动空袭之际，Polymarket平台上的投注者正大赚一笔——该平台上与空袭时间相关的合约交易额高达5.29亿美元。几乎与此同时，区块链侦探们便开始追踪近期投注中的异常模式。【原文：As US and Israeli bombs fell on Iran this weekend, bettors on Polymarket — where $529 million was traded on contracts tied to the timing of the strikes — were cashing in. Almost immediately, blockchain sleuths began hunting for unusual patterns in recent bets.】

item.title: 美国就业增长在强劲的1月后料将放缓
item.description: 美国就业人数增长在经历一年来最强劲的招聘月后，二月份可能已回落至更为温和且可持续的招聘水平。【原文：US payrolls growth probably settled back in February after the strongest month of hiring in a year, returning to a more moderate and likely sustainable pace of hiring.】

item.title: 私募信贷股票预示更多痛苦即将到来：《信贷周刊》
item.description: 收入下滑、股息削减、贷款减记：本周部分透明度最高的私募信贷基金公布的业绩，未能安抚担忧市场存在"蟑螂"的投资者。【原文：Falling income, slashed dividends and loan markdowns: the results from some of the most transparent private credit funds this week have done little to soothe investors concerned about cockroaches in the market.】

item.title: 玻利维亚紧急销毁空难中从天而降的现金
item.description: 玻利维亚当局正紧急销毁价值可能高达数百万美元的本国货币——这些钞票在该国第二大城市的一场致命空难中突然从天而降。【原文：Bolivian authorities are scrambling to destroy what likely amounts to millions of dollars worth of local currency that suddenly fell from the sky in a deadly plane crash in the country’s second largest city.】

item.title: 以色列因伊朗袭击事件关闭天然气田
item.description: 以色列在与美国联合对伊朗发动袭击后，下令暂时关闭部分天然气田。【原文：Israel ordered the temporary shutdown of some natural gas fields after launching an attack on Iran in a joint operation with the US.】

item.title: 美国农民将特朗普的新关税视为又一轮不稳定因素
item.description: 在特朗普总统实施关税政策后动荡不安的一年里，美国农民一直在寻求某种稳定。但随着上周新的贸易动荡，不确定性正日益成为唯一不变的因素。【原文：US farmers have been looking for some stability after a mercurial year under President Donald Trump’s tariffs. But after new trade upheaval last week, it’s becoming increasingly clear that uncertainty is the only constant.】

item.title: 中国呼吁美以轰炸伊朗后立即停火
item.description: 在美以对伊朗发动袭击后，中国呼吁立即停火，习近平政府正权衡在中东地区的应对方案。【原文：China called for an immediate ceasefire following the US and Israel’s attacks on Iran, as President Xi Jinping’s government weighs its options in the Middle East.】

item.title: 英国财政部与国防部冲突公开化
item.description: 英国财政部与国防部之间围绕一项旨在改造英国军队的巨额支出计划的长期争端本周浮出水面，起因是该计划引发了对一份价值10亿英镑（13亿美元）直升机合同的质疑。【原文：A simmering dispute between the Treasury and Ministry of Defense over a massive spending plan designed to transform Britain’s military tumbled into public view this week after it raised doubts about a £1 billion ($1.3 billion) helicopter contract.】

item.title: 原油与黄金因超流动性而上涨，加密货币价格全天候反映伊朗风险
item.description: 随着美国、以色列与伊朗之间的冲突不断升级，全球市场情绪受到冲击，部分投资者开始寻求全天候对冲工具，加密货币交易者于周末纷纷涌向去中心化交易所Hyperliquid。【原文：Crypto traders flocked to decentralized exchange Hyperliquid over the weekend as the escalating conflict between the US, Israel and Iran rattled global sentiment and sent some investors seeking round-the-clock hedges.】

item.title: 特朗普不愿承认关税是错误，但我们大多数人确实后悔
item.description: 前索尼首席执行官迈克尔·林顿与投资者乔什·施泰纳阐述了他们从那些广为人知的失误中汲取的教训。【原文：Former Sony head Michael Lynton and investor Josh Steiner explain what they learned from their very public mistakes.】
